summary.span: 表示提供对 XML 数据进行快速、非缓存、只进访问的读取器。

span.span: Represents a reader that provides fast, non-cached, forward-only access to XML data.

summary.span: 从 .NET Framework 2.0 开始，建议改用 类。

span.span: Starting with the .NET Framework 2.0, we recommend that you use the class instead.

remarks.format: ## Remarks > [!NOTE] > 从 .NET Framework 2.0 开始，我们建议使用 方法创建 实例，以利用新功能。Starting with the .NET Framework 2.0, we recommend that you create instances by using the method to take advantage of new functionality. 提供对 XML 数据流的只进只读访问。 provides forward-only, read-only access to a stream of XML data. 当前节点指读取器所处的节点。The current node refers to the node on which the reader is positioned. 读取器是高级的，使用任何读取方法，属性反映当前节点的值。The reader is advanced using any of the read methods and properties reflect the value of the current node. 此类实现 并符合 W3C 可扩展标记语言（XML）1.0 和 XML 中的命名空间的建议。This class implements and conforms to the W3C Extensible Markup Language (XML) 1.0 and the Namespaces in XML recommendations. `XmlTextReader` 提供了以下功能：`XmlTextReader` provides the following functionality: - 强制执行格式正确的 XML 的规则。Enforces the rules of well-formed XML. - `XmlTextReader` 不提供数据验证。`XmlTextReader` does not provide data validation. - 检查 `DocumentType` 的节点是否格式正确。Checks that `DocumentType` nodes are well-formed. `XmlTextReader` 检查 DTD 的格式是否良好，但不使用 DTD 进行验证。`XmlTextReader` checks the DTD for well-formedness, but does not validate using the DTD. - 对于 `XmlNodeType.EntityReference` 的节点，将返回一个空 `EntityReference` 节点（即， 属性为 `String.Empty`）。For nodes where is `XmlNodeType.EntityReference`, a single empty `EntityReference` node is returned (that is, the property is `String.Empty`). > [!NOTE] > DTD 中实体的实际声明称为 `Entity` 节点。The actual declarations of entities in the DTD are called `Entity` nodes. 当你在数据中引用这些节点时，它们将被称为 `EntityReference` 节点。When you refer to these nodes in your data, they are called `EntityReference` nodes. - 不扩展默认属性。Does not expand default attributes. 由于 `XmlTextReader` 不执行数据验证所需的额外检查，因此它提供了快速格式正确的分析器。Because the `XmlTextReader` does not perform the extra checks required for data validation, it provides a fast well-formedness parser. 若要执行数据验证，请使用验证 。To perform data validation, use a validating . 若要读取 中的 XML 数据，请使用 。To read XML data from an , use . `XmlTextReader` 引发 XML 分析错误的 。`XmlTextReader` throws an on XML parse errors. 引发异常后，读取器的状态不可预测。After an exception is thrown the state of the reader is not predictable. 例如，报告的节点类型可能不同于当前节点的实际节点类型。For example, the reported node type may be different than the actual node type of the current node. 使用 属性检查读取器是否处于错误状态。Use the property to check whether a reader is in error state. ## 安全注意事项Security Considerations 使用 类时，需要注意以下事项。The following are things to consider when using the class. - 引发的异常 可能会泄露您不希望冒泡到应用程序的路径信息。Exceptions thrown the can disclose path information that you do not want bubbled up to the application. 应用程序必须捕获异常并进行相应的处理。Your applications must catch exceptions and process them appropriately. - 默认情况下启用 DTD 处理。DTD processing is enabled by default. 如果你担心拒绝服务问题，或者如果你正在处理不受信任的源，请禁用 DTD 处理。Disable DTD processing if you are concerned about Denial of Service issues or if you are dealing with untrusted sources. 将 属性设置为 以禁用 DTD 处理。Set the property to to disable DTD processing. 如果启用了 DTD 处理，可以使用 限制 可以访问的资源。If you have DTD processing enabled, you can use the to restrict the resources that the can access. 还可以设计应用程序以使 XML 处理受内存和时间的约束。You can also design your application so that the XML processing is memory and time constrained. 例如，在 ASP.NET 应用程序中配置超时限制。For example, configure time-out limits in your ASP.NET application. - XML 数据可以包含对外部资源（如 DTD 文件）的引用。XML data can include references to external resources such as a DTD file. 默认情况下，外部资源使用没有用户凭据的 对象进行解析。By default external resources are resolved using an object with no user credentials. 通过执行下列操作之一，可以使此操作更加安全：You can secure this further by doing one of the following: - 通过将 属性设置为 对象限制 可访问的资源。Restrict the resources that the can access by setting the property to an object. - 通过将 属性设置为 ，不允许 `null` 打开任何外部资源。Do not allow the to open any external resources by setting the property to `null`. - XML 数据可以包含大量属性、命名空间声明、嵌套元素等，需要大量的时间来处理。XML data can contain a large number of attributes, namespace declarations, nested elements and so on that require a substantial amount of time to process. 若要限制发送到 的输入的大小，请创建一个自定义的 IStream 实现并向其提供 。To limit the size of the input that is sent to the , create a custom IStream implementation and supply it the . - 方法可用于处理大型数据流。The method can be used to handle large streams of data. 此方法一次读取少量的字符，而不是为整个值分配单个字符串。This method reads a small number of characters at a time instead of allocating a single string for the whole value. - 默认情况下不展开常规实体。By default general entities are not expanded. 常规实体在调用 方法时展开。General entities are expanded when you call the method.

remarks.format:
## Remarks > [!NOTE] > 从 .NET Framework 2.0 开始，我们建议使用 方法创建 实例，以利用新功能。Starting with the .NET Framework 2.0, we recommend that you create instances by using the method to take advantage of new functionality. 此构造函数将给定字符串分析为 XML 片段。This constructor parses the given string as a fragment of XML. 如果 XML 片段是元素或属性，则可以绕过格式正确的 XML 文档的根级别规则。If the XML fragment is an element or attribute, you can bypass the root level rules for well-formed XML documents. 下表列出了 `fragType`的有效值。The following table lists valid values for `fragType`. |XmlNodeTypeXmlNodeType|片段可能包含Fragment May Contain| |-----------------|--------------------------| |`Element`|任何有效的元素内容（例如，元素、注释、处理指令、CDATA 节、文本和实体引用的任意组合）。Any valid element content (for example, any combination of elements, comments, processing instructions, CDATA sections, text, and entity references).

还可以提供 XML 声明。An XML declaration can also be supplied. 这允许您为 XML 片段指定编码，而不必在 对象上进行设置。This allows you to specify the encoding for the XML fragment, rather than having to set it on the object.| |`Attribute`|特性的值（引号内的部分）。The value of an attribute (the part inside the quotes).| |`Document`|整个 XML 文档的内容。The contents of an entire XML document. 这会强制文档级别规则。This enforces document level rules.| 读取器使用以下项来确定流的编码。The reader uses the following to determine the encoding of the stream. 1. 检查 属性以确定编码。Checks the property to determine the encoding. 2. 如果 `null``Encoding` 属性，则读取器将检查流开头的字节顺序标记。If the `Encoding` property is `null`, the reader checks for a byte-order mark at the beginning of the stream. 3. 如果 `null``Encoding` 属性，但找不到任何字节顺序标记，则读取器假定流采用 UTF-8 编码。If the `Encoding` property is `null`, and no byte-order mark is found, the reader assumes the stream is encoded in UTF-8.

## Remarks > [!NOTE] > 从 .NET Framework 2.0 开始，我们建议使用 方法创建 实例，以利用新功能。Starting with the .NET Framework 2.0, we recommend that you create instances by using the method to take advantage of new functionality. 此构造函数将给定字符串分析为 XML 片段。This constructor parses the given string as a fragment of XML. 如果 XML 片段是元素或属性，则可以绕过格式正确的 XML 文档的根级别规则。If the XML fragment is an element or attribute, you can bypass the root level rules for well-formed XML documents. 此构造函数可处理从 返回的字符串。This constructor can handle strings returned from . 下表列出了 `fragType` 的有效值以及读取器如何分析每个不同的节点类型。The following table lists valid values for `fragType` and how the reader parses each of the different node types. |XmlNodeTypeXmlNodeType|片段可能包含Fragment May Contain| |-----------------|--------------------------| |元素Element|任何有效的元素内容（例如，元素、注释、处理指令、CDATA 节、文本和实体引用的任意组合）。Any valid element content (for example, any combination of elements, comments, processing instructions, CDATA sections, text, and entity references).

还可以提供 XML 声明。An XML declaration can also be supplied. 这允许您为 XML 片段指定编码，而不必在 对象上进行设置。This allows you to specify the encoding for the XML fragment, rather than having to set it on the object.| |AttributeAttribute|特性的值（引号内的部分）。The value of an attribute (the part inside the quotes).| |DocumentDocument|整个 XML 文档的内容。The contents of an entire XML document. 这会强制文档级别规则。This enforces document level rules.| ## Examples 下面的示例分析 XML 片段。The following example parses an XML fragment. 它使用 `XmlParserContext` 及其 来处理命名空间解析。It uses the `XmlParserContext` and its to handle namespace resolution. remarks.format: ## Remarks > [!NOTE] > 从 .NET Framework 2.0 开始，我们建议使用 方法创建 实例，以利用新功能。Starting with the .NET Framework 2.0, we recommend that you create instances by using the method to take advantage of new functionality. 由于 执行缓冲 `Read`，因此它必须能够返回未使用的缓冲区的剩余部分，以便不会丢失任何数据。Because does a buffered `Read`, it must be able to return the remainder of the unused buffer so that no data is lost. 这允许协议（如多部分 MIME）将 XML 打包到与其他项目相同的流中。This allows protocols (such as multi-part MIME) to package XML in the same stream as other things. 调用此方法后， 设置为 `true`。After calling this method, is set to `true`. ## Examples 下面的示例读取 XML 文档的第一部分，然后使用 `GetRemainder` 通过第二个读者完成文档读取。The following example reads the first part of an XML document and then uses `GetRemainder` to complete reading the document using a second reader. summary.span: 获取或设置一个值，该值指示是否规范化空白区域和属性值。

span.span: to normalize; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks > [!NOTE] > 从 .NET Framework 2.0 开始，我们建议使用 方法创建 实例，以利用新功能。Starting with the .NET Framework 2.0, we recommend that you create instances by using the method to take advantage of new functionality. 此属性可随时更改，并在下一次读取操作时生效。This property can be changed at any time and takes effect on the next read operation. > [!NOTE] > 如果 用于构造 ，若要规范化特性值，`Normalization` 必须设置为 `true`。If the is used to construct an , to normalize attribute values, `Normalization` must be set to `true`. 如果 `Normalization` 设置为 `false`，则这也会对数值实体禁用字符范围检查。If `Normalization` is set to `false`, this also disables character range checking for numeric entities. 因此，允许使用字符实体，如 `�`。As a result, character entities, such as `�`, are allowed. 下面介绍特性值规范化：The following describes attribute value normalization: - 对于字符引用，将所引用的字符追加到属性值。For a character reference, append the referenced character to the attribute value. - 对于实体引用，循环处理该实体的替换文本。For an entity reference, recursively process the replacement text of the entity. - 对于空格字符（#x20、#xD、#xA #x9），将 #x20 追加到规范化值。For a white space character (#x20, #xD, #xA, #x9), append #x20 to the normalized value. （对于作为外部分析的实体一部分的 "#xD # xA" 序列或内部分析实体的文本实体值，只追加一个 #x20。）(Only a single #x20 is appended for a "#xD#xA" sequence that is part of an external parsed entity or the literal entity value of an internal parsed entity.) - 通过将其他字符追加到已标准化的值处理这些字符。Process other characters by appending them to the normalized value. - 如果声明的值不是 CDATA，则丢弃任何前导空格和尾随空格（#x20）字符，并使用单个空格（#x20）字符替换空格（#x20）字符序列。If the declared value is not CDATA, discard any leading and trailing space (#x20) characters and replace sequences of space (#x20) characters with a single space (#x20) character. `XmlTextReader` 仅执行特性或 CDATA 规范化。The `XmlTextReader` only performs attribute or CDATA normalization. 除非包装在 `XmlValidatingReader`中，否则它不会执行 DTD 特定的规范化。It does not do DTD-specific normalization unless wrapped within an `XmlValidatingReader`. 有关规范化的进一步讨论，请参阅 W3C XML 1.0 建议。Refer to the W3C XML 1.0 recommendation for further discussion on normalization. ## Examples 下面的示例演示打开并关闭规范化的读取器行为。The following example shows reader behavior with normalization turned on and then off. [!code-cpp[XmlTextReader.Normalization#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlTextReader.Normalization/CPP/readnormal.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[XmlTextReader.Normalization#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlTextReader.Normalization/CS/readnormal.cs#1)] [!code-vb[XmlTextReader.Normalization#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlTextReader.Normalization/VB/readnormal.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks > [!NOTE] > 从 .NET Framework 2.0 开始，我们建议使用 方法创建 实例，以利用新功能。Starting with the .NET Framework 2.0, we recommend that you create instances by using the method to take advantage of new functionality. 默认情况下，将启用 DTD 处理以便向后兼容。DTD processing is enabled by default for backwards compatibility. 但是，除非你的应用程序需要 DTD 处理，否则你应禁用此设置。However, unless your application requires DTD processing, you should disable this setting. 禁用 DTD 处理对避免受到某些拒绝服务攻击非常有用。Disabling DTD processing can be useful in preventing certain denial of service attacks. 如果设置为 `true`，则读取器在遇到 DTD 内容时将引发 。If set to `true`, the reader throws an when any DTD content is encountered. 如果已启用 DTD 处理，则需要注意包含来自不受信任源的 Dtd 以及可能的拒绝服务攻击。If you have DTD processing enabled, you need to be aware of including DTDs from untrusted sources and possible denial of service attacks. 使用 限制 可以访问的资源。Use the to restrict the resources that the can access. 还可以设计应用程序以使 XML 处理受内存和时间的约束。You can also design your application so that the XML processing is memory and time constrained. 例如，在 ASP.NET 应用程序中配置超时限制For example, configure time-out limits in your ASP.NET application

remarks.format: ## Remarks > [!NOTE] > 从 .NET Framework 2.0 开始，我们建议使用 方法创建 实例，以利用新功能。Starting with the .NET Framework 2.0, we recommend that you create instances by using the method to take advantage of new functionality. 这是处理嵌入 XML 文档中的大量文本流的最有效方法。This is the most efficient way to process very large streams of text embedded in an XML document. `ReadChars` 每次返回一个缓冲区，而不是分配大字符串对象。Rather than allocating large string objects, `ReadChars` returns text content a buffer at a time. 此方法旨在仅适用于元素节点。This method is designed to work only on element nodes. 其他节点类型会导致 `ReadChars` 返回 `0`。Other node types cause `ReadChars` to return `0`. 在以下 XML 中，如果读取器定位在开始标记上，`ReadChars` 将返回 `test` 并将读取器定位在结束标记后。In the following XML, if the reader is positioned on the start tag, `ReadChars` returns `test` and positions the reader after the end tag. ```xml test ``` `ReadChars` 具有以下功能：`ReadChars` has the following functionality: - 此方法仅适用于元素节点。This method is designed to work on element nodes only. 其他节点类型导致 `ReadChars` 返回0。Other node types cause `ReadChars` to return 0. - 此方法返回实际字符内容。This method returns the actual character content. 不会尝试解析实体、CDATA 或遇到的任何其他标记。There is no attempt to resolve entities, CDATA, or any other markup encountered. `ReadChars` 返回开始标记和结束标记之间的所有内容，包括标记。`ReadChars` returns everything between the start tag and the end tag, including markup. - `ReadChars` 忽略格式不正确的 XML 标记。`ReadChars` ignores XML markup that is not well-formed. 例如，在读取以下 XML 字符串 `12`时，`ReadChars` 返回 `12`。For example, when reading the following XML string `12`, `ReadChars` returns `12`. （它从匹配的元素对返回标记并忽略其他标记。）(It returns markup from the matching element pair and ignores others.) - 此方法不执行任何标准化。This method does not do any normalization. - 当 `ReadChars` 到达字符流的末尾时，它将返回值0，并且读取器位于结束标记之后。When `ReadChars` has reached the end of the character stream, it returns the value 0 and the reader is positioned after the end tag. - 使用 `ReadChars`时，特性读取方法不可用。Attribute read methods are not available while using `ReadChars`. 例如，使用下面的 XML：For example, using the following XML: ```xml some text ``` 在 while 循环结束时，读取器定位在 `` 元素上。The reader is positioned on the `` element at the end of the while loop. ```csharp if (XmlNodeType.Element == reader.NodeType && "thing" == reader.Name) { while(0 != reader.ReadChars(buffer, 0, 1) { // Do something. // Attribute values are not available at this point. } } ``` ## Examples 下面的示例使用 `ReadChars`读入 XML。The following example reads in XML using `ReadChars`. [!code-cpp[Classic WebData XmlTextReader.ReadChars Example#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Data/Classic WebData XmlTextReader.ReadChars Example/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[Classic WebData XmlTextReader.ReadChars Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Data/Classic WebData XmlTextReader.ReadChars Example/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[Classic WebData XmlTextReader.ReadChars Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Data/Classic WebData XmlTextReader.ReadChars Example/VB/source.vb#1)] 示例使用 `items.xml` 文件作为输入。The example uses the `items.xml` file as input. remarks.format: ## Remarks > [!NOTE] > 从 .NET Framework 2.0 开始，我们建议使用 方法创建 实例，以利用新功能。Starting with the .NET Framework 2.0, we recommend that you create instances by using the method to take advantage of new functionality. 此方法对内容进行流式处理，对 `Base64` 的内容进行解码，并将解码后的二进制字节（例如内联 `Base64`编码的 GIF 图像）返回到缓冲区中。This method streams the content, decodes the `Base64` content, and returns the decoded binary bytes (for example, an inline `Base64`-encoded GIF image) into the buffer. 可以连续调用此方法以读取大量嵌入文本。This method can be called successively to read large streams of embedded text. 有关详细信息，请参阅 RFC 1521 "MIME （多用途 Internet 邮件扩展）第一部分：指定和描述 Internet 邮件正文格式的机制"。For more information, see RFC 1521, "MIME (Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions) Part One: Mechanisms for Specifying and Describing the Format of Internet Message Bodies". 你可以从[征求意见](https://www.rfc-editor.org)网站获取 rfc。You can obtain RFCs from the [Request for Comments Web site](https://www.rfc-editor.org). > [!NOTE] > 在方法返回值0之前，不应访问对 方法的调用之间的任何读取器属性。You should not access any of the reader properties between calls to the method until the method returns the value 0. 此方法具有以下行为：This method has the following behavior: - 在达到其所操作的字节流的末尾时返回值0。 returns the value 0 when it has reached the end of the byte stream it was operating on. 读取器定位在第一个非内容节点上。The reader is positioned on the first non-content node. - 如果请求的字节数少于或小于的字节数，则读取器将保留在其当前位置。If you ask for fewer, or the exact number, of bytes than are left in the stream the reader remains in its current position. - 以下 XML 节点类型不支持 ： `Element`、`XmlDeclaration`、`None`、`Document`、`DocumentType`、`Notation`、`Entity`、`DocumentFragment`。 is not supported on the following XML node types: `Element`, `XmlDeclaration`, `None`, `Document`, `DocumentType`, `Notation`, `Entity`, `DocumentFragment`.

remarks.format: ## Remarks > [!NOTE] > 从 .NET Framework 2.0 开始，我们建议使用 方法创建 实例，以利用新功能。Starting with the .NET Framework 2.0, we recommend that you create instances by using the method to take advantage of new functionality. 此方法读取元素内容，使用 Base64 编码对其进行解码，并将解码后的二进制字节（例如内联 Base64 编码 GIF 图像）返回到缓冲区中。This method reads the element content, decodes it using Base64 encoding, and returns the decoded binary bytes (for example, an inline Base64 encoded GIF image) into the buffer. 有关详细信息，请参阅 RFC 1521 "MIME （多用途 Internet 邮件扩展）第一部分：指定和描述 Internet 邮件正文格式的机制"。For more information, see RFC 1521, "MIME (Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions) Part One: Mechanisms for Specifying and Describing the Format of Internet Message Bodies". 你可以从[征求意见](https://www.rfc-editor.org)网站获取 rfc。You can obtain RFCs from the [Request for Comments Web site](https://www.rfc-editor.org). 此方法只能读取简单内容元素。This method can only read simple-content elements. 元素可以包含文本、空格、有效空白、CDATA 部分、注释和处理指令。The element can contain text, white space, significant white space, CDATA sections, comments and processing instructions. 它还可以包含自动扩展的实体引用。It can also contain entity references, which are automatically expanded. 元素不能有子元素。The element cannot have child elements. 此方法与 方法非常相似，只不过它只能在元素节点类型上调用。This method is very similar to the method except that it can only be called on element node types. 如果 `count` 值大于文档中的字节数，或者它等于文档中的字节数，则 读取文档中的所有剩余字节并返回读取的字节数。If the `count` value is higher than the number of bytes in the document, or if it is equal to the number of bytes in the document, the reads all the remaining bytes in the document and returns the number of bytes read. 下一个 方法调用返回零，并将读取器移动到 后的节点。The next method call returns a zero and moves the reader to the node following the . 如果在所有元素内容使用之前调用 ，则读取器的行为可能与第一个内容的行为相同，然后调用 方法。If you call before all of the element content is consumed, the reader may behave as if the first content was consumed and then the method was called. 这意味着读取器将读取所有文本，直到遇到结束元素。This means that the reader reads all the text until the end element is encountered. 然后读取结束标记节点，读取下一个节点，然后在下一个后续节点上定位自身。It then reads the end tag node, reads the next node, and then positions itself on the next subsequent node. ## Examples 有关使用此方法的示例，请参阅 。See to see an example using this method.

remarks.format: ## Remarks > [!NOTE] > 从 .NET Framework 2.0 开始，我们建议使用 方法创建 实例，以利用新功能。Starting with the .NET Framework 2.0, we recommend that you create instances by using the method to take advantage of new functionality. 此方法读取元素内容，使用 `BinHex` 编码对其进行解码，并将解码后的二进制字节（例如内联 `BinHex` 编码 GIF 图像）返回到缓冲区中。This method reads the element content, decodes it using `BinHex` encoding, and returns the decoded binary bytes (for example, an inline `BinHex` encoded GIF image) into the buffer. 此方法只能读取简单内容元素。This method can only read simple-content elements. 元素可以包含文本、空格、有效空白、CDATA 部分、注释和处理指令。The element can contain text, white space, significant white space, CDATA sections, comments and processing instructions. 它还可以包含自动扩展的实体引用。It can also contain entity references, which are automatically expanded. 元素不能有子元素。The element cannot have child elements. 此方法与 方法非常相似，只不过它只能在元素节点类型上调用。This method is very similar to the method except that it can only be called on element node types. 如果 `count` 值大于文档中的字节数，或者它等于文档中的字节数，则 读取文档中的所有剩余字节并返回读取的字节数。If the `count` value is higher than the number of bytes in the document, or if it is equal to the number of bytes in the document, the reads all the remaining bytes in the document and returns the number of bytes read. 下一个 方法调用返回零，并将读取器移动到 后的节点。The next method call returns a zero and moves the reader to the node following the . 如果在所有元素内容使用之前调用 ，则读取器的行为可能与第一个内容的行为相同，然后调用 方法。If you call before all of the element content is consumed, the reader may behave as if the first content was consumed and then the method was called. 这意味着读取器将读取所有文本，直到遇到结束元素。This means that the reader reads all the text until the end element is encountered. 然后读取结束标记节点，读取下一个节点，然后在下一个后续节点上定位自身。It then reads the end tag node, reads the next node, and then positions itself on the next subsequent node. ## Examples 有关使用此方法的示例，请参阅 。See to see an example using this method.

remarks.format: ## Remarks > [!NOTE] > 从 .NET Framework 2.0 开始，我们建议使用 方法创建 实例，以利用新功能。Starting with the .NET Framework 2.0, we recommend that you create instances by using the method to take advantage of new functionality. 读取器使用 `XmlResolver` 来解析加载到读取器中的文件的位置，还可以解析 DTD 引用。The reader uses `XmlResolver` to resolve the location of the file loaded into the reader and also to resolve DTD references. 例如，如果您的 XML 包含 DOCTYPE 声明，`` 读取器解析此外部文件，并确保 DTD 格式正确。For example, if your XML included the DOCTYPE declaration, `` the reader resolves this external file and ensures that the DTD is well-formed. 读取器不使用 DTD 进行验证。The reader does not use the DTD for validation. 此属性可随时更改，并在下一次读取操作时生效。This property can be changed at any time and takes effect on the next read operation. 如果将此属性设置为 `null`，则不会解析读取器遇到的任何外部 DTD 引用。If this property is set to `null`, any external DTD references encountered by the reader are not resolved. 在 [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)]版本1.1 中，如果未设置此属性，则应用程序的信任级别将确定默认行为。In version 1.1 of the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)], if this property is not set, the trust level of the application determines the default behavior. `Fully trusted code:` 读取器使用没有用户凭据的默认 。`Fully trusted code:` The reader uses a default with no user credentials. 如果访问网络资源需要身份验证，请使用 `XmlResolver` 属性指定具有所需凭据的 `XmlResolver`。If authentication is required to access a network resource, use the `XmlResolver` property to specify an `XmlResolver` with the necessary credentials. `Semi-trusted code:` `XmlResolver` 属性设置为 `null`。`Semi-trusted code:` The `XmlResolver` property is set to `null`. 不解析外部资源。External resources are not resolved. ## Examples 下面的示例使用 `XmlResolver` 属性指定访问网络文件所需的凭据。The following example uses the `XmlResolver` property to specify the credentials necessary to access the networked file. [!code-cpp[XmlTextReader.XmlResolver#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlTextReader.XmlResolver/CPP/rdr_resolver.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[XmlTextReader.XmlResolver#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlTextReader.XmlResolver/CS/rdr_resolver.cs#1)] [!code-vb[XmlTextReader.XmlResolver#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlTextReader.XmlResolver/VB/rdr_resolver.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks > [!NOTE] > 从 .NET Framework 2.0 开始，我们建议使用 方法创建 实例，以利用新功能。Starting with the .NET Framework 2.0, we recommend that you create instances by using the method to take advantage of new functionality. ## Examples 如果找到 `xml:space='preserve'` 范围，以下示例将分析文件并返回重要的空白区域。The following example parses a file and returns significant white space if an `xml:space='preserve'` scope is found. [!code-cpp[XmlTextReader.XmlSpace#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlTextReader.XmlSpace/CPP/readspace.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[XmlTextReader.XmlSpace#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlTextReader.XmlSpace/CS/readspace.cs#1)] [!code-vb[XmlTextReader.XmlSpace#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlTextReader.XmlSpace/VB/readspace.vb#1)] 该示例使用文件（`authors.xml`）作为输入。The example uses the file, `authors.xml`, as input.
